pullRequest.body:
Add rfl, symm and trans lemmas for ringEquivCongr.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8147552408/job/22268536061)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8147552408/job/22268535818)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8147552408/job/22268535231)

Can you state this by saying that if `h : a = b` and `h' : b = a`, then `(ZMod.ringEquivCongr h).symm = ZMod.ringEquivCongr h'`?

I am wondering if it is worth to use `h'` also in your statement (they're of course the same, but I am not sure whether `rw` is smart enough to see through proof irrelevance, and I am afraid is not).

Same for transitivity below.
I think your suggestion doesn't make it more general because all proofs are defeq ...
I don't claim it is more general (as you say it surely isn't): I am just not sure `rw` or whatever will always realize it.

I think the following shows this shouldn't be a concern; `← ringEquivCongr_symm hba.symm` produces `hba.symm.symm` on the RHS and Lean has no trouble unifying it with `hba`.
```lean
lemma ringEquivCongr_symm {a b : ℕ} (hab : a = b) :
    (ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab).symm = ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab.symm := by
  subst hab; cases a <;> rfl

lemma ringEquivCongr_symm' {a b : ℕ} (hab : a = b) (hba : b = a) :
    (ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab).symm = ZMod.ringEquivCongr hba := by
  rw [← ringEquivCongr_symm hba.symm] -- works
```
I was too lazy to make this test, thanks!

The current `ringEquivCongr_symm` can be proved using my `ringEquivCongr_symm` as follows, so I'm not sure we should have it in mathlib:
```
lemma ringEquivCongr_symm'' {a b : ℕ} (hab : a = b) (x : ZMod a) (y : ZMod b) :
    y = ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab x ↔ x = ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab.symm y := by
  rw [← ringEquivCongr_symm hab, eq_comm]; symm; apply Equiv.eq_symm_apply
```

FWIW [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/d6631726d30ff5fddbfd2a01d7dac9096c18ba17/Mathlib/NumberTheory/Cyclotomic/CyclotomicCharacter.lean#L198-L203) is my application. I suspect that any symmetry statement will do.
I've gone with `alreadydone`'s `symm`.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma ringEquivCongr_rfl {a : ℕ} : ZMod.ringEquivCongr (rfl : a = a) = .id _ := by
```
(It appears to be `.refl`)

By the same token, this should probably be
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma ringEquivCongr_trans {a b c : ℕ} (hab : a = b) (hbc : b = c) :
    (ZMod.ringEquivCongr hab).trans (ZMod.ringEquivCongr hbc) = ZMod.ringEquivCongr (hbc ▸ hab) :=
  by ...
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (ringEquivCongr hab).trans (ringEquivCongr hbc) = (ringEquivCongr (hab ▸ hbc)) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (ringEquivCongr hbc) ((ringEquivCongr hab) x) = (ringEquivCongr (hab ▸ hbc)) x := by ```

```suggestion
    (ringEquivCongr hab).trans (ringEquivCongr hbc) = ringEquivCongr (hab ▸ hbc) := by
```

if you like
```suggestion
    (ringEquivCongr hbc) (ringEquivCongr hab x) = ringEquivCongr (hab ▸ hbc) x := by
```
This is simply `DFunLike.congr_fun (ringEquivCongr_symm hab) y` so I think we don't need it ...
I wrote it because I thought I needed it in the application but indeed I didn't.

```suggestion
    (ringEquivCongr hab).trans (ringEquivCongr hbc) = ringEquivCongr (hab.trans hbc) := by
```
Yeah this did occur to me when I was writing it! I can't imagine it makes much difference.

Maybe
```suggestion
lemma ringEquivCongr_ringEquivCongr_apply {a b c : ℕ} (hab : a = b) (hbc : b = c) (x : ZMod a) :
    ringEquivCongr hbc (ringEquivCongr hab x) = ringEquivCongr (hab.trans hbc) x := by
```
since there is no mention of `trans` on the LHS

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/ZMod/Basic): more ringEquivCongr API
